sentence.content: But they took heart from Tuesday&apost;s presidential show: President Clinton&apost;s passionate insistence that the realities of the global marketplace be faced; President Carter&apost;s attack on Mr Ross Perot, the populist billionaire, as a demagogue with &apost;unlimited financial resources,&apost;; President Bush&apost;s praise of Mexican President Carlos Salinas; President Ford&apost;s warning that the country would be overrun by impoverished immigrants from the South if they are given no work at home.

sentence.content: Without Nafta, the US relationship with Mexico could &apost;deteriorate,&apost; and &apost;much of what people are worried about will happen, perhaps more speedily without Nafta than with it.
